etymology.description: 止(止) (zhǐ, "stop") as the phonetic component + 龍(龙) (lóng, "dragon") originally stylized as teeth = appearance of teeth
etymology.interpretation: The character 齒(齒) represents 'teeth' by combining the phonetic component 止(止) with 龍(龙) originally stylized to resemble a row of teeth, emphasizing the appearance and function of teeth.
etymology.simplification: 齒(齒) was simplified to 齿(齿) by removing complex strokes in 龍(龙), though it retained the visual reference to teeth.

examples.chinese: 他的齿(他的齒)洁白如玉(潔白如玉)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de chǐ jiébái rú yù.
examples.english: His tooth is as white as jade.

examples.chinese: 医生诊断后(醫生診斷後)，建议患者定期检查齿(建議患者定期檢查齒)。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng zhěnduàn hòu, jiànyì huànzhě dìngqī jiǎnchá chǐ.
examples.english: After the diagnosis, the doctor advised the patient to have regular tooth examinations.

examples.chinese: 晨曦微露时(晨曦微露時)，他的齿闪烁着希望(他的齒閃爍著希望)。
examples.pinyin: Chénxī wēilù shí, tā de chǐ shǎnshuò zhe xīwàng.
examples.english: In the early morning light, his tooth shimmers with hope.
